snippet: Before engaging in any talks with North Korea, the United States and South Korea want to see signs that the North will dismantle its nuclear program, officials said.
abstract: South Korean nuclear negotiators affirm that they will not hold formal talks with North Korea until it shows that it is willing to dismantle its nuclear weapons program; statement shows that South Korea is holding firm to stance despite easing of tensions on Korean Peninsula.
lead_paragraph: Before engaging in any talks with North Korea, the United States and South Korea want to see signs that the North will dismantle its nuclear program, officials said.

headline.main: South Korea And U.S. Stay Firm on Talks With North
headline.print_headline: South Korea And U.S. Stay Firm on Talks With North

keywords.value: Arms Control and Limitation and Disarmament
keywords.name: subject
